whoWeAre.1: An Egyptian pioneer software house in the field of Transport Automation, Integration Solutions and Business Process Management, Integrated Solutions for Ports (ISFP) provides the necessary expertise required to develop local and regional ports in the field of Information Technology and Communications.
whoWeAre.2: Our leading enterprise modeling products and solutions enable transport organizations to visualize, understand, analyze, improve, audit and continually enhance complex operating processes and IT infrastructures. With the objective of setting new performance standards in the Transport business, ISFP operates to create first quality transport automation systems, as well as provide installation, operation, consultation and training services
whoWeAre.3: Established in 2005, under the memorandum of understanding concluded between the Egyptian Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Communications & Information Technology and The Arab Academy for Science, Technology & Maritime Transport.

aboutUs.ourVision: To become the leading company in offering IT services to the Maritime Transport Sector in the Middle East by providing the latest and most up-to-date technological solutions and techniques so as to promote and upgrade Egyptian and regional ports, container terminals and cargo terminals.
aboutUs.ourMission: Provide the maritime ports with appropriate IT integrated solutions that help improve ports operation efficiency & performance through business process re engineering, specialized software solutions, outsourced IT management services and developing customer staff through customized professional technical training.

SPS.description: ISFP developed a port operating system named Smart Port Solution (SPS). SPS is a package of applications developed specifically to serve main activities in ports and terminals. SPS is the first Egyptian and Arab IT product to be developed locally and specifically established for this purpose. In addition to the huge number of features implemented in the package it can handle the port operating model, landlord model and port terminals

ERP.description: SMART ERP software helps organizations effectively manage their critical resources with an array of scalable solutions

SIB.description: SIB is an integration middleware to perform intermediary services for the integrated parties, moreover a web application to provide a variety of collaboration services.

Egypt.overView: In order to meet rising customer expectations and stay ahead of the competition, APA sought to enrich the overall port operation services by moving to a paperless environment and providing a valuable and relevant solution that completely restructures the manual process of documents exchange between port community members. Automation aimed at and achieved the optimization of the Port Management Processes from decreasing the vessel and cargo turn-around time to making available the necessary real time data for yard operations and performing all statistical and data analysis for decision makers.

ISFP acts as an IT implementer and operator at the Damietta Port. Process Reengineering was the first step undertaken at the Damietta Port, in an aim to establish an automated workflow. This was followed by the implementation of an international port management package. developed by Zebra Solutions (NAVIS). ISFP also developed the integration system between members of the port community and the port authority and is responsible for the daily operation of the Electronic Data Center at the Port.

The project aims to manage & control processes related to the General Authority for Land & Dry Ports GLDAP in the land ports stated ( Taba, Qasta & Arquen). This is a TURNKEY project. The solution includes IT infrastructure (supplies & implementation) and Application (design, development & implementation ). The solution will handle all processes related to passengers and cargo including E-payment. The information from the three ports will be replicated at the HO in GLDAP to generate statistical & follow up reports for decision makers.

The project is a turnkey project  about establishing port management system in Suez Port including providing and implementing IT infrastructure components (Servers, switches, fiber cabling, end user equipmentâ€™s, â€¦etc)  and the daily IT operation activities. Another major part in the project is to develop a mini databank for Red Sea ports operational data and get required indicators and integrated reports for red sea ports to help decision makers. The project includes developing the required electronic messages for communicating data among members of the port Community and between them and the port authority, through an electronic message exchange system

As the Egyptian state council aims to keep pace with recent technological development of judicial work in the modern world, it contracted ISFP to automate its business processes. The project aims at improving the efficiency of case resolution while raising the quality of courts provided services

The project scope includes:: Automation of the various courts of the state council: The administrative courts, Administrative judiciary, Disciplinary courts as well as the Supreme Administrative Court.
Automation of the state council back office: Financial, Human resources, warehouses and archiving.
Consultationfor the technological infrastructure needed for the automation project

Improve the services provided to clients: Publishing online court services: e-filing, e-payment, e-notifications
Facilitate litigation procedures to save time and expedite adjudication
Availing public data or remote private access to case data only for involved parties
Facilitating judges work: Automatic activation of the court decisions once the session is over (notifications, claims of fines, placement of proceedings in court sessions, classification and preparation of cases lists)
The electronic annexation of two lawsuit cases
Avoid registering in many paper records such as schedule records, agendas, session diaries, etc.
A 24/7 workspace available to the judge with all the updated resources and documents (at the court or remotely)
State council senior management: Minimizes human intervention in the work cycle, hence minimizing corruption
Monitor and control over the work cycle from senior management
Supporting senior management in decision making by providing accurate reports and statistics
Economic and social effect: Improves transparency and increases public confidence
Improves national KPIs that measures Justice application in a certain country

Egypt.overView: The Adabeya Port Project was first of it's type for ISFP to deliver a turnkey solution, All with what it includes from infrastructure components and software applications. The first phase of the Adabeya Project was about establishing an electronic management system in the port. This required establishing a professional standardized workflow before actually automating it. implementing the necessary applications required for automating the different operations in the port. The Second phase of the Adabeya Project includes integrating and establishing electronic linkage among members of the port community and between them and the port authority, through an electronic message exchange system.

The project is about establishing an electronic management system in Nuweiba port and implementing A single window system for trade between Nuweiba port and El-Aqaba port. This required establishing a professional standardized workflow before actually automating it. The project includes integrating and establishing electronic linkage among members of the port Community and between them and the port authority, through an electronic message exchange system.

The project aims to manage the flow of the incoming and outgoing paper mails for The Egyptian Minister Of Transportation office. Also, The document flow between employees in the same department and between departments is managed by the system

The project aims to manage the flow of the incoming and outgoing paper mails for Egyptian Maritime Transport Sector. Also, The document flow between employees in the same department and between departments is managed by the system.

The project aims to automate the internal process in the Red Sea Ports Authority, Egypt. The project was a turn key project including integration with the port management system implemented in the Red Sea Authority Ports. The system includes the financial module , Human Resources module , Commercial module , Procurement module , Secretary module and Inventory module.

The system integrates data and processes of all portâ€™s business departments. The system includes the financial module , Procurement module , Secretary module and Inventory module. The system is integrated with Port Management System SPS which is implemented for the port operations.

The project aims to automate the internal process in Ocean Express Shipping, Egypt. The system integrates data and processes of all companyâ€™s business departments. The system includes the financial module , Human Resource module, Procurement module, Secretary module and Inventory module.

The project aims to automate the internal process in the Rail Projects Company , Egypt. The project was a turn key project. The system includes the Financial module , Human Resources module , Commercial module , Procurement module , and Inventory modules.

The Egyptian Maritime Data Bank EMDB is the first specialized data bank in the Middle East, Africa and the Arab World.EMDB aims to provide planners, decision-makers and researchers from various maritime fields with accurate information on all activities of the Egyptian maritime sector.EMDB is using about 21 subsystems implemented over a huge datacenter. The data is updated through all Egyptian maritime ports. ISFP is responsible of keeping the EMDB with best performance 24/7 through maintaining software applications, Database, networks , data security and operating systems.

DCHC is one of  the biggest Egyptian container terminals located on  the meditrainean shore . DCHC is planning to fully implement Navis Sparcs N4 in order to automate operations , controlling when the container is supposed to move, which piece of equipment is going to move it and where it's going to be moved. ISFP successfully started Navis Sparcs N4 implementation at DCHC on November 2017. In order to achieve the success of the implementation, ISFP  lead the implementation of the wireless network at DCHC.

Libya.overView: As a maritime business consultant, ISFP has conducted an automation business study for the different operational activities at Misurata port.
As the Socialist peopleâ€™s Libyan Arab Great Jamahiriya the Single Window Initiative to facilitate external trade, the Lybian government currently working to automate the Maritime Sector

Lebanon.overView: The Project aims to develop and implement an integrated system for managing port operation activities Including vessel movement, cargo handling, gates control and bills issuing processes.

Sudanese.overView: The project aims to design and development a single window for the Sudanese Ports. It includes the design and development of electronic portal for the ship traffic processes.

News & Events.title: The State Council Contract
News & Events.overView: The President of the Egyptian State Council, Dr. Ahmed Abul Azm,  Dr. Ismail Abdel Ghafar
News & Events.subject: President of the Arab Academy for Science & Technology & Maritime Transport AASTMT and Mrs Hala El-Sheridy CEO of Integrated Solutions For Ports ISFP  signed  the contracts of implementation of Automation System for State Council. (date 5/12/2018)

News & Events.title: Maritime Transport Sector
News & Events.overView: Maritime Transport Sector (MTS) and Integrated solutions for ports (ISFP)
News & Events.subject: have signed the contract of a new project for the development of a new system for the Egyptian Maritime Data Bank. The new system will be linked to the current port automation systems in the Egyptian ports. The new system will use the latest technologies to provide online KPIâ€™s and statistical reports for Egyptian ports, vessel traffic, handled cargo. The new system will be live by the 2nd half of 2021 and its services will be also available to non - governmental entities through subscriptions. Also, ISFP will start a new service for economic analysis for Egyptian maritime sector data to support decision-makers.

News & Events.title: Smart Court Management System
News & Events.overView: The Intellectual Property Rights Office affiliated to the Egyptian Ministry of Communications and Information Technology
News & Events.subject: has issued the certificate that recognizes the intellectual property rights for Smart Court Management System CMS for Integrated Solutions For Ports ISFP company. ISFP has developed this system to manage the courts of the Egyptian Council of State. It is currently being implemented in all Egyptian courts.

News & Events.title: ISFP granted the Excellence Award by The Egyptian Ministry of Transportation
News & Events.overView: ISFP granted the Excellence Award by The Egyptian Ministry of Transportation
News & Events.subject: ISFP has been granted the Excellence Award by The Egyptian Ministry of Transportation during the celebrations of The World Maritime Day - 2022, The trophy was granted for launching the Yacht tourism single window system. Using this system, Tourists can plan and apply for their visit to Egypt by Yachts. The system provide several online services, like providing required information and scanned documents, Receive all governmental approvals from the involved ministries and Online payment for all governmental fees in a single invoice.

News & Events.title: partnership agreement
News & Events.overView: partnership agreement to implement studying the establishment of an Arab mechanism and a database to support the field of ship repair and construction industry in the Arab countries.
News & Events.subject: Engineer Hani Salem Sonbol, CEO of the International Islamic Trade Finance Corporation, formally greeted His Excellency Dr. Ismail Abdel Ghaffar Ismail Farag, President of the Arab Academy for Science, Technology and Maritime Transport  And in the presence of Engineer / Hala Al-Shraidi, CEO of Integrated Solutions for Ports Where the two parties signed a partnership agreement to implement studying the establishment of an Arab mechanism and a database to support the field of ship repair and construction industry in the Arab countries. Which will be implemented by the Integrated Solutions for Ports Company During the meeting, the two sides discussed joint cooperation and projects that are being completed under the umbrella of the Trade Assistance Initiative for Arab Countries (AFTIAS 2.0) program.
